summary: The "powers of the EP" refers to the legislative, budgetary, and supervisory authority of the European Parliament (EP) within the EU institutional framework. As a co-legislator, the EP exercises its powers in conjunction with the Council of the European Union, shaping EU law through proposals, amendments, and approvals. It holds significant budgetary powers, influencing the allocation of EU funds and ensuring accountability. Additionally, the EP monitors the actions of the European Commission and other institutions, reinforcing democratic oversight. This interplay of powers is crucial for maintaining the balance of authority and ensuring effective governance within the EU legal and regulatory landscape.
